intro: Navia lindmanioides, commonly known as the Lindman's navia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and smartweed. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Navia lindmanioides is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky slopes.
